Recycled Clay; Reclaimed Clay; Waste Clay Brick (WCB)
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Waste clay mainly comes from two channels: firstly, during the refining process of plant oils and fats, activated clay (mainly composed of organic bentonite) with a weight of 2% to 5% of the oil is usually used for adsorption and decolorization. After decolorization, waste clay generally adsorbs 20% to 40% of the oil; The second reason is that the waste clay from the refinery comes from the refining process of paraffin and lubricating oil, which is a gray black soil with a slight solvent odor and contains about 30% wax or oil. At present, directly filling, stacking, and burying waste clay after extracting oil cannot fundamentally solve the problem of secondary pollution. The waste clay obtained after oil extraction still contains oil and other components, such as neutral oils, non-hydrated phospholipids, natural pigments, fatty acids, and vitamins in the waste clay of vegetable oils. Resource utilization can be achieved through reasonable processing methods, including mixing with coal as fuel and using it as agricultural organic fertilizer.

废白土主要来自两个渠道：一是植物油脂精炼过程中, 通常使用油重2%~5%的活性白土（主要成分是有机膨润土） 进行吸附脱色， 脱色后的废白土中一般吸附有20%~40%的油脂； 二是炼油厂废白土来自石蜡和润滑油精制工序，为灰黑色泥土状，带有轻微溶剂气味，含蜡或油在30％左右。目前废白土经提取油分后直接填、堆、埋，不能从根本上解决二次污染问题。提油后得到废白土仍然含有油脂等成分， 如植物油脂的废白土含有中性油脂、非水化磷脂、天然色素、脂肪酸和维生素等。 可通过合理的处理方法，实现资源化利用，包括与煤炭混合作为燃料使用、用作农业有机肥料等。
